options.

inlineContent.text: , a string that you choose. You use this
string to identify your widget when reloading its timeline with
The timeline provider is an object that determines the timeline for
refreshing your widget. Providing future dates for updating your widget
allows the system to optimize the refresh process.
The content closure contains the SwiftUI views that WidgetKit needs to
render the widget. When WidgetKit invokes the content closure, it passes a
timeline entry created by the widget provider’s
Modifiers let you specify the families your widget supports, and the
details shown when users add or edit their widgets.

abstract.text: Extend the reach of your app by creating widgets, watch complications, Live Activities, and controls.
Leverage WidgetKit’s API to create watchOS complications using SwiftUI.
Display your app’s content in a convenient, informative widget on various devices.
Support accessory widgets that appear on the Lock Screen and as complications on Apple Watch.

doc://com.apple.WidgetKit/documentation/.title: Creating accessory widgets and watch complications

abstract.text: An object describing the content of a widget that has no user-configurable
options.
Creates a configuration for a widget, with no user-configurable
options.
Offer widgets in additional contexts by adding support for various widget sizes.
Provides a timeline entry that represents the current time and state of a
widget.
Provides an array of timeline entries for the current time and,
optionally, any future times to update a widget.
Donate intents and indicate relevance to automatically show your widget in Smart Stacks when it has useful information to display.

doc://com.apple.WidgetKit/documentation/.title: Increasing the visibility of widgets in Smart Stacks

abstract.text: Constants that indicate the rendering mode for an
in when displayed in a widget
in
mode.
An object that contains a list of user-configured widgets and is used for
reloading widget timelines.
Values that define the widget’s size and shape.
Constants that indicate the rendering mode for a widget.
The system divides the widget’s view hierarchy into an accent group and
a default group, applying a different color to each group.
Offer Live Activities, controls, animate data updates, and add interactivity to widgets.

doc://com.apple.WidgetKit/documentation/.title: Emoji Rangers: Supporting Live Activities, interactivity, and animations

abstract.text: Create an app with persistent data, interactive widgets, and an all new in-app purchase experience.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Backyard Birds: Building an app with SwiftData and widgets

abstract.text: The configuration and content of a widget to display on the Home screen or in Notification Center.
A container used to expose multiple widgets from a single widget extension.
Runs the given action when the system provides a background task.
The content and behavior of this widget.
Sets the name shown for a widget when a user adds or edits it using the specified string.
Sets the name shown for a widget when a user adds or edits it using the contents of a text view.
Sets the localized name shown for a widget when a user adds or edits the widget.
Sets the description shown for a widget when a user adds or edits it using the contents of a text view.
Sets the description shown for a widget when a user adds or edits it using the specified string.
Sets the localized description shown for a widget when a user adds or edits the widget.
Adds an action to perform when events related to a URL session identified by a closure are waiting to be processed.
Adds an action to perform when events related to a URL session with a matching identifier are waiting to be processed.
Sets the sizes that a Live Activity supports.
Sets the sizes that a widget supports.
Offer Live Activities, controls, animate data updates, and add interactivity to widgets.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Emoji Rangers: Supporting Live Activities, interactivity, and animations

abstract.text: Create a shared codebase to build a multiplatform app that offers widgets and an App Clip.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Fruta: Building a Feature-Rich App with SwiftUI

abstract.text: Create widgets to show your app’s content on the Home screen, with custom intents for user-customizable settings.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Building Widgets Using WidgetKit and SwiftUI

abstract.text: A type that describes a widget’s content.
A type that represents part of your app’s user interface and provides modifiers that you use to configure views.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
